question: Is golodirsen effective for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy?
ideal_answer: Yes, golodirsen can be considered effective for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy.

snippets.text: Golodirsen is a provisionally approved PMO-based drug for approx. 8% of all DMD patients amenable to exon 53 skipping.
This article summarizes the milestones in the development of golodirsen leading to this first approval for DMD.

n December 2019, intravenous golodirsen received its first global approval in the USA for the treatment of DMD in patients with a confirmed mutation of the DMD gene that is amenable to exon 53 skipping, based on positive results from a phase I/II clinical trial
To date, four PMOs, including eteplirsen, casimersen, viltolarsen, and golodirsen, have been conditionally approved by the FDA for the treatment of DMD.
Golodirsen increased dystrophin protein (16.0-fold; P < 0.001) and exon skipping (28.9-fold; P < 0.001).
This study provides evidence for golodirsen biologic activity and long-term safety in a declining DMD population and suggests functional benefit versus external controls.
